dublin_core.dcvalue: Tayne, K., Shapiro, R. B., Jurow, A. S., & Hollingsworth, M. (2018). Pre-service Teachers’ Perspectives on Computer Science Education Within an Equity-Oriented Teacher Education Program. In Kay, J. and Luckin, R. (Eds.) Rethinking Learning in the Digital Age: Making the Learning Sciences Count, 13th International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018, Volume 3. London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

This is a small-scale case study of pre-service teachers’ perspectives on teaching and learning computer science (CS) after they participated in an equity-oriented teacher education program. We found that this program appeared to support pre-service teachers (PTs) in developing more expansive views on CS teaching and learning. Findings point to the broader importance that PTs’ experience CS with children in a learning environment that supports expansive learning opportunities with CS.
International Society of the Learning Sciences, Inc. [ISLS].
Pre-service Teachers’ Perspectives on Computer Science Education Within an Equity-Oriented Teacher Education Program
dublin_core.dc:subject: teacher education
computer science education
equity
